intro: Gaylussacia bigeloviana, commonly known as the red-berried huckleberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, acidic leaves and clustered flowers. The plant produces edible, red berries that ripen in the fall, providing food for wildlife and humans alike. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and thickets. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological system in its native habitat.
